comments.content: Eh. I guess for Spanish it wouldn't hurt taking a couple lessons here and there. There are a ton of latinos at 銘傳大學, and I guess if you like the nightlife (like most do) you could hit up the Latino club/bars. The last time I went it was called mi casa but I know they've changed the name and location (I haven't been clubbing for years).

first.content: Thanks, buddy. I sure will check out the curriculum there.
first.name: Jerry Chang

comments.content: Have you tried this app called "duolingo"? I self-taught myself French with that app before I took French 101 back in college and it helped a lot, I basically didn't need to study for half of the semester. They also have Spanish courses along with a lot other European language. I personally find it very useful and helpful up to some point 😗 bon chance!

first.content: Wow, that's awesome! Got it, thanks for the info.
first.name: Jerry Chang
